meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unwilling to spend money or share resources.
meanings.sent1: Her tightfistedness made it difficult for her to enjoy simple pleasures.
meanings.sent2: His tightfistedness was evident when he refused to contribute to the group gift.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tightfistedness, he couldn't resist buying a new gadget.
meanings.sent4: Her tightfistedness was like a locked vault, guarding her savings fiercely.
meanings.sent5: The image of her counting every penny showcased her tightfistedness.

meanings.definition: A tendency to be stingy or miserly.
meanings.sent1: The old man's tightfistedness was legendary in the small town.
meanings.sent2: She inherited her father's tightfistedness when it came to charitable donations.
meanings.sent3: His tightfistedness was so extreme that he reused tea bags to save money.
meanings.sent4: The company's tightfistedness with bonuses led to low employee morale.
meanings.sent5: The tightfistedness of the landlord resulted in neglected maintenance of the property.
